forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. Northeast wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a serene stillness blankets the city. The air is crisp, with temperatures hovering around a cool 45 degrees, promising a brisk morning. The sky, partly cloudy, hints at sun-kissed moments ahead while a gentle northeast breeze whispers through the streets. As the day unfolds, expect a shift towards a partly sunny disposition, with temperatures inching up to a modest high near 58. By afternoon, a cooling trend sets in, and it may feel even chillier, encouraging layers against the fading warmth.

Currently, the cityscape is devoid of fog, revealing outlines of the iconic skyline with clarity. Yet, being November, remnants of the marine layer could gather again as the day wanes. This is a perfect opportunity for leisurely pursuits: perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero, where one can admire the Bay and savor the fresh air. For those venturing out, a light jacket will keep the chill at bay, along with comfortable shoes to explore winding streets or quaint cafes. As morning gives way to afternoon, take a moment to enjoy the subtle shifts in light and atmosphere—qualities that make San Francisco uniquely enchanting, even on a cool day in late fall.
